text: Donald John Shepherd (12 August 1927 - 18 August 2017) was a Welsh cricketer. He played for Glamorgan. One of the great county bowlers, he took more first- class wickets, 2,218 at 21.32 each, than any other player who never played Test cricket. He was born in Port Eynon, Glamorgan, Wales. Shepherd played regularly to the end of the 1971 season, and then retired from first-class cricket after a few games in 1972. He often appeared as a summariser on BBC Radio Wales coverage of Glamorgan matches. Shepherd died on 18 August 2017 in Glamorgan, Wales of vascular dementia, aged 90.Don Shepherd: Glamorgan great dies aged 90 ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2017 deaths Category:English and Welsh cricketers Category:Welsh sportspeople
